website_summaries.verdict: The best overall ceiling heater with a good blend of heat output and a possible light source.
pros: Ceiling heater runs quiet and cool during long periods of use
Provides a good amount of circulation in small-to-medium size spaces
cons: Requires special bulbs to use properly

customer_reviews.title: here are the proper instructions
customer_reviews.text: the fan works great if you can install it properly. for installation with the panasonic FV-WCSW41 switch (designed for this fan), the enclosed instructions for the fan unit and the switch are useless (and incomplete). please find enclosed a schematic of the complete and proper instructions. fyi the panasonic website is not helpful with support.
customer_reviews.author: clueless in seattle

customer_reviews.title: It is quiet and the heater works awesome. Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: This is so worth the price. It is quiet and the heater works awesome. Can't go wrong! Note- my electrician said it should really be vented through the roof. As a "hack" he vented it through one of the screened openings in the soffit-serves sames purpose but without cutting hole in roof. He also went the extra mile and installed a timer swtich for the heater.....get it in the commercial section of home depot.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Filbey

customer_reviews.title: Fan did not suck up moisture.
customer_reviews.text: We installed this and the vent barely sucked up any moisture, bathroom shower still steamy. We did a tissue test, and the fan would not suck the tissue to the vent, where the less powerful, older panasonic fan we had, the tissue sticks to the vent. Don't know why there were so many good reviews, perhaps we got a faulty unit.
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure why this fan has such good ratings. The heater option is nice and works ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why this fan has such good ratings. The heater option is nice and works well but the exhaust fan is horrible and basically does nothing at all. Just to test it out, I had a friend light a cigarette in my bathroom. We watched the smoke in the air and the smoke was barely being being pulled from the room. Then I held a piece of paper to the fan and the fan could barely hold the one piece of paper. Terrible product...
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: A little anxious after the installation reviews but delighted - quiet as promised
customer_reviews.text: My twenty year old fan/heater/exhaust combo in my small bathroom was noisy and failing. Replaced with the slick Panasonic. A little anxious after the installation reviews but delighted - quiet as promised, pumps out heat and doubled the light. Since the unit’s designed for new construction my carpenter had to demo the 31” x 52” ceiling [one hour including surveying the project.] Installing and wiring consumed two hours, repairing and replacing another four, a total of seven hours. He estimates new construction might be three hours. I was unhappy when I discovered two CFLs with unfamiliar twist stud bases pondering how I might convert to LEDs. Not necessary - the CFIs lit immediately
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hyman

customer_reviews.title: An indulgence for sure
customer_reviews.text: My GC's reaction was - "you spent WHAT for an exhaust fan?". Once installed, however, it has quite capably done the job. We have a 2 headed shower, and have to run both heads on full blast for a looooong time before the bathroom mirror starts to fog up, even a little bit. The heater is pretty darn nice. Works best when the exhaust is switched off, and it 's like standing under a blow dryer (8ft ceilings). By the time I brush/floss/rinse my hair is nearly dry. Because it works so well, I decided against installing a timer switch, which saved a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Publius

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, hard-to-get bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit but beware the light bulbs: the 18W fluorescents used are not the bulbs that you will find at a home improvement store. The Panasonic bulbs (FDS18E35/4) use a special base (G24q-2, not the usual G24q-1 stores carry), Panasonic doesn't sell them anymore, and you have to order generic versions online at Amazon or eBay. The Panasonic bulbs in my units lasted only a year, so you will like,y need to replace the ones that come with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Galen M. Gruman

customer_reviews.title: the heat element is much better made and should last for many years
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these units, and they both have been a huge improvement over the last two we had. The fans are so much quieter, the heat element is much better made and should last for many years. The way the unit is constructed, you can actually use the heat and the vent at the same time... my last units, you could only use one at a time. Have had these units for about 6 months and have had no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Tom V

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic
customer_reviews.text: I did a remodel in my bathroom and used this unit and so glad I did it’s worth every Penney very quiet and powerful exhaust fan,heater is good for what I needed but does not disperse as high as exhaust but definitely serves the purpose but you will need minimum of a 10 amp breaker in your electrical panel box,I compared many of bath exhaust units, but this one in particular lives up to the price, cheaper models are much nosier and not as powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: The Best Fan/Heater You Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: Based upon most of the reviews, I had high expectations for the Fan/Heater. It was a little pricey but I remember the old saying "buy quality, you won't be disappointed." I replaced an existing fan/heater which finally went out. It was loud and the heater was not that great. This item is amazing! The heater works great and it works so well that we have to turn it off after a while. The fan is the quietest and most efficient I have ever seen. Installation was time consuming for me but I did not have any issues. Your mileage may vary. Anyway, I do not write reviews for many products but this deserved the 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Takes Too Long to Warm
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first one because of a defect. Thank you Amazon. Now to the performance of the product. The noise level is moderate. However, it takes a long time to warm. And in retrospect, I'd wish there was a light incorporated. The size was much larger than expected, especially without a light incorporated. If you are planning a renovation and buying building materials or fixtures, it is a good idea to order when you are very very close to install. So many unexpected things can come up during renovations that could extend the timeframe and if you have return an item.
customer_reviews.author: Evette H.

customer_reviews.title: Not so quiet, not so hot.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan because they said it was really quiet but I found it's just as noisy as any other bathroom fan you hear. Also my bathroom is 850 cubic feet and this heater does not heat this area. The fan is right next to the shower and when you get out of the shower it does not feel particularly warm there. If I had it to do over again I would look for a fan that puts out more heat and I wouldn't worry about the noise level too much.
customer_reviews.author: Bklvr

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: first evaluation this fan is great.. superlow noise with amazing power due to fan design, only little complaint with the electrical box so small and hard to wire up to connect the power. and it should have noted in the instruction book that this fan/heater required a 20amp dedicated circuit. I have to do a little research just to be safe but it does need a 20amp wire because the heater pulls large amount of power. fivestar for now but anything changes in the future you will see an update.
customer_reviews.author: arleen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!  Worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 bathrooms and bought the top 2 rated fans. How I wish I bought 2 of this fan only. It is so quiet I can't hear it unless I try hard to. I had my electrician install it since I had read it was difficult to do as a homeowner. He installed it no problem, but honestly, it is worth the money. The other fan I purchased that is highly rated is noisy, like a typical fan. The electrician installed that one too. My electrician is awesome, and even he said that in his opinion this fan is the best on the market. I agree.
customer_reviews.author: rgb

customer_reviews.title: Heater too powerful, fan a little too quiet. ...
customer_reviews.text: Heater too powerful, fan a little too quiet. I think this unit is for a extra large bathroom maybe 200 ft2. The fan is way too quiet so if you're doing a #2 people outside the bathroom can still hear the sound effects of what you're doing. For my medium sized bathroom the heater is unbearable after about 4 to 5 minutes. The reason for the 5 star review is because it does what it claims but I would not get it for a small or medium sized bathroom unless you live alone Alaska
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Islas

customer_reviews.title: Heating unit did not work, not standing behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this combination light, fan and heater for my bathroom for the heating unit, this summer when i remodeled my bathroom. The unit arrived but the heater in the unit does not work. I contacted the seller and i was supposed to recieve a replacement heating unit. That was this summer early fall. My unit has been installed and her it is last of January 2019 and i have mot recieved replacement heating unit or fan. The seller back this summer contacted me and promised to get unit out. I am very dissatisfied with this purchase and additional money spent for what i thought was going to be a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: 4.75 stars, couple of minor things could have been designed better.
customer_reviews.text: Would give it 4.75 stars if possible. Pros: -Super quiet -Appears to clear moisture well in my 8x10 ft bathroom. -Heater is warm. Improvements: -The box for wiring is too small. Seems like it might not even meet NEC box fill requirements. There is plenty of space to have designed in a bigger box. -The heat fan shoots straight down, seems like it could be designed to distribute the heat better. One other subtle thing to note, I wish I would have oriented the fan 90 degrees differently. You can see the guts through the fins from the entrance of the bathroom. Kind of like if you put a vent cover on upside down.
customer_reviews.author: mjolhe01

customer_reviews.title: customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is my revised review after not hearing anything back for a while we finally have our issues resolved with Panasonic. Used for a little over a week. Then it caught on fire. I contacted Panasonic they took a report and I emailed photos. After about a week and a half I herd back from Panasonic. They replaced the heater/exhaust fan. I returned the old one to have it tested. They said this is the first issue they have had. I will continue to use the new one and watch it closely.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wall

customer_reviews.title: quiet great value
customer_reviews.text: Decided to buy this one after much research. Tired of those cheap noisy units from the box stores that are in my old bathroom. After i installed it i couldn't believe how quiet it really is. I bought mine with the heating option and it warms the room up in minutes and not having those heat bulbs gives it a cleaner look. The one thing other reviews mentioned is the tight wire install. There is an easy fix. Leave enough wire past the box. Pull the wire box out of the fan make your connections and then slide back up into fan and then pull excess back out the side and secure it.
customer_reviews.author: amazon prime user

customer_reviews.title: Works great for heat and light
customer_reviews.text: Works great for heat and light. Really is horrible for venting. Don't make any difference weather it's on or off. And my vent to outside is straight and short.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: I like them very much
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these. I like them very much. Draws a lot of air (Fan), and is pretty quiet. Heater works well, but takes a minute to warm up before coming on. seems counter productive to run both at the same time, so I run the fan while showering, then reach out and hit the heater (when it's cold)... while I wipe down the shower. Never had an issue with any Panasonic products... I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Worked as indicated, Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product worked as indicated. Haven't had any issues with this unit. Only downside to this product is the noise level and the light. It is very noisy, I installed it in the bathroom that's in my family room in the basement. Anytime this unit is turned on, I can hear it in floor above. The heating unit on it is great, my family room is about 800 sq ft and on more than one occasion someone has left it on, unit has heated up the entire area pretty good. If this might be an issue for you, then install a timer with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose M.

customer_reviews.title: ... and my wife wanted a quiet fan with a good heater. This thing is real quiet and the ...
customer_reviews.text: We did a full bathroom remodel and my wife wanted a quiet fan with a good heater. This thing is real quiet and the heater "kicks!!!". We had to take everything down to studs so the install was not that difficult. It would have be more difficult if trying to add this unit and the extra wires to operate all the functions independently. This unit has four functions the heater, fan, main light and night light. As mentioned we were down to the studs and adding the wiring and the support studs were easy.
customer_reviews.author: S Ede

customer_reviews.title: ... replacing an existing one - HOWEVER - I HIGHLY recommend Panasonic vents
customer_reviews.text: This was the wrong heater and I had to return it - as I was replacing an existing one - HOWEVER - I HIGHLY recommend Panasonic vents, heat/vents, heat/vent/lights. I run a construction company and literally refuse to install anything other than Panasonic. They are quiet and efficient and the heaters are the best on the market
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey_Hepburn

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Just installed as part of BR remodel. I Like that every feature is controlled separately. You can light, ventilate and/or heat all at once or as separately controlled functions. I ditched the stupid compact fluorescent bulbs for LED's. Make sure you get a GU24 bulb, which has two prongs, not a screw in bulb. Heater seems to warm up fairly well. Fan is ridiculously quiet.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Bockius III

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made chose this one!
customer_reviews.text: The fans are quiet and the motors are high quality. It has two separate fans, one for exhaust and one for the heater. Be aware that if when you turn on the heater it will make a click sound and run at slow speed for a minute while the heating element gets up to temperature, then the fan kicks on higher speed.
customer_reviews.author: jshaw

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan with great heater
customer_reviews.text: Love this fan. Our old one was very loud, it would wake people up. We spent double for this one over another because reviews mentioned how quiet it is. This one is very quiet. Heater function works great. My wife really likes this heater fan. Now if I could just get people to stop heating and exhausting the air at the same time it would be a beautiful thing.
customer_reviews.author: Nastytotems

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our master bathroom that measures aprox. 10ft by 10ft. The fan is really quiet and the heater does the job. Only problem i had is that the wiring box inside the unit is EXTREMELY small and with all the wiring connections required it is EXTREMEMLY difficult to get it all in there. Have patience and bandaids when wiring this beast. Also, the wiring connection from the manufacturer inside the unit is malfunctioning, i will need to fix that before I am able to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: This heater/fan is a great unit. We took our bathroom back to the studs, brought in new electrical and plumbing service, and on the advice of our electrician, installed this unit. The fan is strong and quiet and the heater is a power house, warming the bathroom quickly and with a really nice heat. I highly recommend this unit. It does need a dedicated circuit.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Valley Girl

customer_reviews.title: It’s a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This beast is an ordeal to install. Having said that, the heater is amazing on those cold mornings. The condensation is best reduced when running the heater and fan simultaneously. If you’re just running the fan, the mirror will still get a little steamed up. Overall, great purchase, and I’m glad I have a handy husband who installed it. Again, the installation is a lengthy ordeal, but so worth it when the bathroom is cold! Pretty quiet too!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson Rude Azevedo, High School Principal

customer_reviews.title: Greatest combo fan,light, heater.
customer_reviews.text: Great fan light heater combo. A must have if you want to remove the steam from the bathroom and heated at the same time. No steam on walls after installing this fan kit.. Just run heater like 5 min before showering and throughout the shower. Leave heater on for like 5 or 10 min after shower with exhaust fan and no steam on walls, mirror!
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to any bathroom, any where, quiet, just the right amount of heat.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this when I remodeled my shower in my home. It really takes the edge off those cold mornings, really enjoy walking into a warm shower now. I used a Leviton fan timer (20A) to control heater and the exhaust fans. Then I used a double rocker switch (Leviton) for controlling the night light and overhead flourescent light in the same fixture. Will require a 20 A service connection.
customer_reviews.author: S.I.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's supposed to. I definitely appreciate ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to. I definitely appreciate the inside-chassis wiring with ample space to contain the new wires without fording them back. Internal wires also come well labeled on this model (light, fan, nightlight, heat). It does use 4 switches though, it's a shame there is no internal switch to allow nightlight to be on whenever the main light is off so you'll probably need to wire the main light with the fan and leave heat and nightlight on their own switches even if you already had a heater setup before.
customer_reviews.author: O. Kidd

customer_reviews.title: A Terrific Fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is terrific for removing steam. My bathroom had no windows, and the original fan did not pull out all the steam from showers. As a result, mold and mildew were a constant problem. However, this fan eliminated that problem. It makes very little noise and provides a helpful source of light and heat to warm you up. However, it is not something people who are not familiar with electrical connections should install on their own. It is complicated, and you need someone who understands how to make the appropriate electrical connections and make sure it sits securely in the ceiling. Otherwise, it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Esq

customer_reviews.title: Heater burnt out in first use. Followed directions, ...
customer_reviews.text: Heater burnt out in first use. Followed directions, confirmed amperage of circuit, wire sizing, etc. Followed manufacturers recommendations and still did not work. Tried to contact Panasonic on multiple occasions. Was never able to replace the heater. The end of story was that the unit just functions as an exhaust fan and not longer a heater or night light.
customer_reviews.author: D. Balter

customer_reviews.title: Likely the Best You Can Get
customer_reviews.text: This was probably overkill for our 2 bath remodel project, but I am glad we got these.The fan is super quiet, as is the heater. It is also big and may be difficult to install without a large cut out in the ceiling. If you get one, buy the outlet timer for the heater and multiple wall switch that I used. They both work great with this unit:
customer_reviews.author: Car Guy

customer_reviews.title: The heater portion works great - the fan is advertised as whisper - it's ...
customer_reviews.text: The heater portion works great - the fan is advertised as whisper - it's loud and it's not drawing air out or in - it just sounds like a fan spinning?
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Good but not overly impressed with it.
customer_reviews.text: It seems well built and strong. I built a wood frame and mounted it on it due to the weight. A few points to note: 1. The area where the connections are made for the power source is very small - If you are using two sets of three wire, do one set, then the second. 2. The heater takes a few minutes to warm up and when it does, the fan kicks on to blow hot air. 3. The vent fan is noisy compared to the fan I replaced which cost much less. 4. The heater puts out warmth but it isn't hot.
customer_reviews.author: dr Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great heater!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed. Heater produces wonderful warm air. There is a delay when you turn on the heater, but that is normal because it a "blah, blah, thingama thing" (my husbands technical jargon) as part of the safety features. Installation was a little difficult, but I think that was because of our situation/attic space, not the product itself. The vent fan is nice and quiet. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lessie R. Redican

customer_reviews.title: Actually quite quiet and puts out a nice amount of heat.
customer_reviews.text: Put this in the bathroom to replace a fan that was never used just outside our shower. It really is a lot quieter than any other heater/fan combo I've had. Puts out a good amount of heat that you can really feel but not so much that it stifles you. Electricians ran a dedicated line to the breaker panel. Warms up quickly. Looks like in the ceiling, doesn't call attention to itself. No issues with it so far. Very pleased with how it operates.
customer_reviews.author: Winelover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade for chilly bathrooms
customer_reviews.text: When we remodeled our house, there was no place to put a forced air vent in the bathroom. We opted for this amazing device and loved it. It pumps out enough warm air to make the small room quite toasty, and the fan is powerful enough to recirculate air all the way to the floor. Installation wasn't fast, but it was pretty easy. I definitely recommend having a helper when installing this fan because it is bigger and heavier than most devices you'll be removing. It is sized perfectly to fit between two standard joists, so you'll only need to enlarge your drywall opening in order to make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M

customer_reviews.title: A very good ceiling fan/heater combo.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best ceiling heater/fan combo you can get for your bathroom. You will need to make sure you install separate switches for the Light, Nightlight, Fan, and Heater. My electrician combined the light, nightlight, and fan as 1 switch and the heater as the 2nd switch. I was not a happy camper. After 2 years and 6 months of ownership, one of the light sockets went out. I called the warranty # and was able to get a entire light socket panel shipped within 2 weeks. It was very easy to replace and only took about 10 minutes with a philips screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Not too hard to install. This is a super quiet heater and vent combo. The night light is a nice option as well. It heats up my 150sqft. master bath in less than 10 minutes. I was leery at first spending this much on a product when there are cheaper ones to choose from, but now I'm happy I did. I would purchase it again and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brighten my day and warm my mornings
customer_reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise. Really nice complement to my bath. Works like a gem, quiet as could be, heats like a mother. What more could I ask for. Had a guy install for me. Took a bit of time as it should. Do it right the first time. Also install ENERLITES HET06 White 5-10-30-60 timer. $18.87 Works great from day one. Could not ask for anything more. O , I did buy the extended warranty just in case. Could get expensive if need to ship out etc. It's heavy so brace this good.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Why is it $83 more now than a year ago?!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fan. I got the one without the light. Had it installed for almost a year. Works well, happy with it. Ready to update my second bathroom, but this fan that I purchased at 182, with prime shipping now sells for 250 plus 15 shipping. So I will NOT buy another!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Quietest fan on the market?
customer_reviews.text: They advertise this as being so quiet, you may not even know that it’s on? Watch my video. Does this seem to be the case? Very disappointed. Panasonic’s customer service has been down for days. No live chat. Phone line is busy. Just sent an email where I was required to fill out irrelevant and wrong information just to try and get someone to talk to.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Miller

customer_reviews.title: The Best ceiling heater vent by far
customer_reviews.text: I own rental properties and other vents that I have purchased are noisy, not very efficient, and cheap, and if left on the heating element will burn out. I switched to this Panasonic unit and I couldn't be more pleased. I have one at home, two in my vacation rentals, and several in my triplexes. High quality, solid, quiet, built to last. This unit is fantastic. Paul
customer_reviews.author: Jan H

customer_reviews.title: Not so quiet plus annoying problem
customer_reviews.text: This unit was a good solution to replace an ancient bathroom heater. The fan is noisier than advertised. The installation manual recommends 2 feet of flexible duct plus an rigid run oh unspecified length. My bathroom is long and narrow. I got the two feet of flex, but there wasn't room for rigid duct. Perhaps the short run contributes to the noise level. I found one very annoying problem with the unit. One of the cfl bulbs flicker when the light is off. From what I read on the Internet it is my lighted switches that are the culprit. Amazingly, panasonic has never heard of any issues. I will probably switch to LEDs to eliminate the flicker.
customer_reviews.author: Rural User

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: We bought this fan to replace an old one that sounded like a jet engine. This is quiet and gets the job done—and would work even better if my wife would ever actually turn it on and vent the Amazon rainforest fog she creates from her 75 minute long showers.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: They are low noise, though not silent. Probably the quietest I’ve heard. Heater works well (had 2 installed in different bathrooms for about a month). Works great. Not cheap to install (had an electrician install them), but probably true of all heater-fans.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: but it offers great exhaust in our bathroom and the heat really warms ...
customer_reviews.text: We had been researching ceiling fans for quite a while until I found this Panasonic. It is so quiet I can hardly tell that it is on, but it offers great exhaust in our bathroom and the heat really warms up the room. I also like that the light has two options on the switch: night light or full light. We will be ordering a second unit to put in our cabin.
customer_reviews.author: MAMAJ

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Searched and searched for the right fan for bathroom remodel. Two features were important...noise and heat. I can barely hear this fan when on and it works like a charm. Summer in Cleveland, have only tested the heat feature. Snow coming soon enough 🤪.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Warranty issue
customer_reviews.text: The fan/heater worked great (5-star) for six months then the heater started making a very loud noise. Reason for 2 star review is I am now on my 7th follow-up in two months to have my warranty claim taken care of. Furthermore, Panasonic does not have a labor allowance to have the new heater installed. Another $150.00 to have the electrician replace the heater, when it finally arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Well made quiet unit. Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Love this fan. Installed in basement bathroom just outside the shower to collect humidity . The heater warms up the 80 square foot bathroom in minutes and you can hardly hear it running . The only downside is that you're looking for a bathroom fan to mask unpleasant bathroom sounds, this is not for you
customer_reviews.author: murdock

customer_reviews.title: I'm an electrician and won't use any other bath fan ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician and won't use any other bath fan than Panasonic...not cheap but you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: K. O'Toole

customer_reviews.title: This heater put out a nice amount of heat.
customer_reviews.text: While remodeling my bathroom, my husband wanted a nice warm heater for my shower area. This heater puts out a nice amount of heat, Which makes it nice when I get out of the shower and the room is cold.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent HVL Unit, except for the lack of a thermostat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these Vent-heat-light units and they work great. I had to design my own mounting system because the manual doesn't give instructions for retro-fit installation. I used a wood frame screwed to the ceiling joists that allowed clearance for the vent hose to turn up into the attic. After I got them installed, I was pleased by the quietness of the fan. One is in a small bathroom and heats it quickly. The other is in a larger one and takes the chill off the room sufficiently. A warning though. There is no thermostat to shut the heater off if you forget. I would give it five stars if it had a thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: The Clowder

customer_reviews.title: Much noiser than advertised
customer_reviews.text: We have another Panasonic Whisper 110 ccm without the heater in a different bathroom. We replaced our previous unit with this one in order to get the same (or similar) sound reduction. This unit is much noiser than our other Panasonic Whisper- so noisy that we had our electrician come back to be sure there wasn't a problem. (He showed me that it's just the way the fan works.) So much for the advertisement on Amazon that it is "so quiet you might not know it's on"! If we could return it we would. We are out the money for the installation and the unit and barely see an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Warm, quiet, large (almost too warm and large for a very small bathroom, but a good problem to have)
customer_reviews.text: Perfect heat and sound level. The bathroom we put this in is actually quite small (approximately 5x8'), and it almost felt a little too warm at first if the fan/window option wasn't available (don't need a heatbox/sauna!), but no doubt I'll be using it in the winter. Love it, just wish it weren't so pricey. However, after reading many reviews, it seemed like the most reliable product, and that's the reason I went with it. May have opted to go for a smaller one, but wanted to get this one to see if I would use them in our larger bathrooms, and the answer is, "Yes,,"--I'll be a repeat customer.
customer_reviews.author: imsusie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our house is 90 plus years old. The bathroom still had a pull-string light until we renovated it recently. This fan is super quiet. The night light is a great touch. No more fumbling for a pull-string in the middle of the night. There wasn't heat in our bathroom until this unit was installed. HUGE upgrade for us. My husband is an electrician and our handy-man super talented, so installation wasn't an issue for us. The light is bright. Great for shaving or doing your hair.
customer_reviews.author: Joann S.

customer_reviews.title: light unit
customer_reviews.text: had pro installed $125 to make house call plus time no complaint then three months later light stoped working now i need two more electrician visits u do the math
customer_reviews.author: CAB

customer_reviews.title: Installed without Difficulty
customer_reviews.text: We have this product installed but since we are not able to finish the house we were rehabbing due to the coronavirus we haven't utilized as yet. Would be happy to write a review at a later time when the house is done and occupied.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Fay

customer_reviews.title: Heat fan is beginning to fail a year after installation.
customer_reviews.text: The fan was purchased in January 2017. It was installed in June of that year. Now it is making noise enough to be quiet annoying. A fluttery sound. The unlucky aspect is I bought two of these units in a renovation. I hope the other does not fail. I have ordered a new heater fan unit and will have my electrician install the new unit easily. The warranty is a carry-in or mail-in warranty whereas the consumer is to pay for labor which combined is just silly of an expense and inconvenience. I am disappointed in Panasonic, I wish they would back up their products like Moen.
customer_reviews.author: Carson E. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a difference from the old bath fan I had. Installed like a normal bath fan. The heater is very warm and quiet (heater kicks in after it warms up for 20 seconds). Very solid and well made, fairly quiet. The night light is very dim, but the regular light is nice (it takes a gr24 bulb). I changed out the main bulbs one with a warm white bulb. We couldn’t be happier, so happy I bought another one for the main bath
customer_reviews.author: Roger Rheaume

customer_reviews.title: Love the heat!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this in a bathroom remodel. The night light is just the right brightness to leave on at all times. Our biggest use is currently the heat function. When we first got it, I thought it odd that when the heat was turned on that it barely trickled out, but that's just the warm up. Once ready to go, the blower kicks in and provides the appropriate heat for our bathroom and is not overly loud. The exhaust fan, when used, is very quiet. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa T

customer_reviews.title: Good as it Gets
customer_reviews.text: Now this is engineered, designed and quality built as I would expect from Panasonic, they are by far one of the last remaining companies who ensure a properly functioning product without fear of reprimand from Wall Street investors. I was amazed to discover that both motors are variable speed and maintain their RPM's if there is any restrictions in the air flow. Everything about this unit exhibits quality,
customer_reviews.author: Dana P. Vogel

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. It is virtually silent compared to my last ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It is virtually silent compared to my last unit. I have it for a 7x7 bathroom and I never have water build up on the mirror any more and the heat can get the room hot in no time. I would buy get again. I have it set up on a 3 switch system so that the nightlight comes on with the heater so I know if it is still on when I leave the bathroom. I am so happy that I did that!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: So far I've been very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: This device is substantial. It seems to be made of quality components. It is also very quiet. I cannot hear either the nightlight or main light (kidding). The exhaust fan as well as the heater operate very quietly. It's been a little too warm to evaluate how well the heater works, but I could tell that it was going to put out a fair amount of heat after running it for a minute. The slats have a decent gap between them, so when the light is on, one can look up and see the components. So far I've been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: briancrc

customer_reviews.title: Whisper? nah...it's more quite than that.
customer_reviews.text: After much review I decided on this fan. Whisper is an understatement, this thing is near silent! Heater is great and having the nightlight and light options are awesome. It is pretty big, be ready for modification of your existing installation if you are retrofitting and do have a separate circuit for the heater, it is pretty power hungry.
customer_reviews.author: F. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Nifty warmer/vent
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness! The best investment ever! We live in a warm to cooler climate but when I step out of the shower I want to be warm and this air warmer is the best!! It also acts as vent. I’m not sure about installation because we had it installed by an electrician when we remodeled our bathroom. I would definitely recommend this air warmer/vent! Love, love, love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heididog

customer_reviews.title: So quiet!  And plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: So quiet, like a new world in our bathroom. Works great! The light/nightlight feature and heater are nice bonuses. We are just so happy to have such a smooth quiet fan to replace the noisy old one we had that finally burnt out its motor. This one comes very highly rated. Don;t forget you need to install it with a Panasonic FV-WCSW41-W WhisperControl Four-Function On/Off Switch.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly quiet, glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: Fan is amazingly quiet and it really moves the air. The heater is good and warms up the bathroom quickly - though if you really want to get warm fast just stand directly under the unit. I thought the heater would continue to blow once turned off (as a "cool down" thing) but it just stops - no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rhino

customer_reviews.title: Heads up- 20 amp breaker (12 gauge wire) is recommended. I wired the fan and heater on 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves getting out of shower into heat. Heads up- 20 amp breaker (12 gauge wire) is recommended. I wired the fan and heater on 2 different 14 gauge 15 amp circuits since I didn’t have a 20 amp breaker in the area and didn’t want to add one that used the 14 gauge wire in place. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Knoblock

customer_reviews.title: Best bathroom fan/heater combo!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this fan/heater almost two years. It works SO well and I love the features (fan, heat, nightlight, light). One of the lights did burn out, but I bought a generic replacement set of 3 on Amazon and it works great. Fan is quieter and works so much better than other fans I have. Would highly recommend this unit and would definitely purchase again if I was remodeling another bath. The heat function is great in the bathroom (if you have a shower in there) in the winter when the house is cool (which I don't mind) but you don't want to be wet and naked and cold as you step out of the shower.
customer_reviews.author: RDP9201

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Knocked off a star for the junction box which is incredibly tiny and very hard to get the wires in. Needed two people for that part of the job. They should have just made the whole fan an inch wider and expanded everything. It would still fit between the beams and you'd have way more space to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Schlosser

customer_reviews.title: Incredible suction!
customer_reviews.text: Clearly the most powerful bathroom fan we have ever owned. This one will keep all the moisture out of the bathroom when showering and the heat will keep you very toasty when you get out. The noise is very low when running as well which is certainly a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Appell

customer_reviews.title: No more cold mornings in the bathroom with this unit ...
customer_reviews.text: No more cold mornings in the bathroom with this unit. I have been using it for 2 years now. Our bathroom is located over the garage and during the winter it is freezing but this fixed it. Just let it warm up for a couple of minutes and the heat is blowing. This also has an exhaust fan so it clears out the humidity during the warmer months. This installed in the same spot as the noisy and cheap builder grade exhaust fan. Since this requires a 20 amp connections (I think) I had to have an electrician install it. These beat space heaters and is much safer. Brownie points with my wife as well.
customer_reviews.author: Space Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Wife raves about it. Likes to stand under the heater after a shower. I use it as a hair drier...which actually works pretty well as the hot air is forced straight down. I'd run #10 wire to the unit, and probably dedicate a breaker to it. Probably says so in the instructions, which I should maybe read beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon O Gourdin

customer_reviews.title: Bathroom Light, Exhaust, and Heater.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent unit for the money. Super quiet. Heater works nice also, just tried it for the sake of trying it. Exhaust is big enough for most size bathroom. This was probably over sized for mine, but that is okay. I recommend wiring it to a timer, because you will probably not hear it and it ma be left on.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Very ,very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is it is soo quiet, it is easy to leave on. No comparision to the Broan it replaced. We put a Panasonic timer on it. When we did a remodel in our other bathroom, did another Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Noisy FV-11VHL2 Whisper???Warm fan
customer_reviews.text: I had this fan installed by an Electricion who recomended this because of other installs he did. The fan itself is large but very nice looking. All the functions work as they are supposed to do except for the noise. No way this is a >.7 scone fan. Runs more like a 4 or 5 scone fans we looked at at the local home depot. I'm very disapointed in this fan. If I wanted all this noise i would have kept the 19 year old van we replaced in this renovation..
customer_reviews.author: D.D.

customer_reviews.title: The heater and lamps work fine, but the fan doesn' t exhaust the air ...
customer_reviews.text: The heater and lamps work fine, but the fan doesn' t exhaust the air at all. It rotates, but is definitely not producing 100 cfm, almost nothing. I am wondering whether this is a broken exempliar or a quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & warm - what a combo!
customer_reviews.text: Bath time for 7 years ended in tears when my daughter was harshly greeted by cold air after leaving the warm water. Move over Johnson & Johnson, since purchasing and installing this quiet fan/heater, Panasonic gets the credit for "No More Tears." This fan/heater is nice and quiet. It's worth spending extra to not have to listen to an annoying buzzing sound. The 0.6 sone level is so quiet that we sometimes forget to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: JaneConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Not as impressed as I though I’d be!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these installed in our house. A friend really talked them up to us so we splurged and brought them. I don’t know if I had just set my expectations too high or what but they really aren’t as quiet as I thought they would be and they don’t keep the steam out. I do however like the heat option on a cold morning. So I’ll give it a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE , LOVE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I ordered and installed two of these last week and completed the install today. The electrical junction box within the fan was large enough to accommodate several #12 solid copper conductors which I wired for three separate switches. This unit allows the installer to have four separate switches, one for the heater, one for the exhaust fan, one for the light and the last for the night night. The heater starts out slow as the element heats up, then it really gets going. This product requires a dedicated 20 amp circuit. The exhaust fan is pretty quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet unit and the heater works great. Warms up the bathroom to a comfortable level
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet unit and the heater works great. Warms up the bathroom to a comfortable level. Very easy to install. Wife said to turn the fan on to see how it sounds and I said it's already running she couldn't believe how quiet it was . Compare to other from home depot this one is awesome. Very pricey but its quality you want not that cheapo stuff
customer_reviews.author: J. adames

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work as Expected
customer_reviews.text: The main light is not very bright. You can't buy replacement bulbs for the damn thing...Seriously?? Why would Panasonic sell some crap like that? I bought the thing partly because of the Panasonic name. I highly, highly recommend against buying this product. Oh and another deal breaker...the fan doesn't really remove much air. My bathroom is 8' x 4'.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: and I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This light's heating fan gets way too hot on heater mode, which makes it unusable.I bought it during the Spring, and had no idea that it would get so hot if left on for a long time. It replaced a Panasonic model which worked perfectly for many years, and I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: consultnet

customer_reviews.title: just as loud as any other ventilation fan ive had ...
customer_reviews.text: just as loud as any other ventilation fan ive had. the warmer is quiet, but the ventilation fan is definitely loud, not so quiet you have to stand under it--i can hear it from across the hall, about 15ft away.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ian Staker

customer_reviews.title: But this is the best of its ilk
customer_reviews.text: This guy rocks. The heater heats. Lot's. The vent vents. bigly. And its all whisper-quiet. The light isn't really bright enough to serve without assistance. It's a fluorescent one, rather than LED. I've got a few other LED lights in my bathroom and I tend to prefer them. But this is the best of its ilk, over-all, I imagine.
customer_reviews.author: rjg

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Install
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy it. Ridiculously difficult to install when replacing an older one. One guy 2-3 hours figuring it out, Two guys, pretty handy guys, half a day. And really,does not warm a medium size bathroom. Save your self a lot of trouble and pass.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Strong yet quiet fan.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exhaust fan with heater. The fan motor is very strong and makes a low soft humming sound when turned on. Nothing annoying. I have not used the heater since it is summer.
customer_reviews.author: New Customer

customer_reviews.title: The fan to have!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a Nutone fan. Taking long showers left so much humidity in the bathroom. The Panasonic fan cured most of those issues. In the wintertime, the wife loves the heat setting. Start living, let go of the red heat lamp bulb. The fan is quiet and powerful. As it was said before, upon installing your unit,you must put a tissue up to the grill to see the fan is working, being that it is so quiet! I still have to drop two lines for the light night light switches. Our second Panasonic Fan/heater does not have the light night light feature. The Panasonic line of bathroom fans is money well spent. We are sold on Panasonic!
customer_reviews.author: NJ Hunter

customer_reviews.title: silent and sleek
customer_reviews.text: Replacing old NuTone's...what a difference! Bow is bigger but so silent at times I love it on b/c I forget it! Great light and heater. I don't use the optional night light but for some it may be a plus. The box is bigger than some other models
customer_reviews.author: fred husserl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if this is what you need
customer_reviews.text: Heater and fan combo unit is great. I put this in a downstairs bathroom and it works marvelously. It’s directional mounting is the only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Machak

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic are the best
customer_reviews.text: I have installed many fans over the years but Panasonic is the go-to brand for me. Panasonic fans are quiet and easy to install. For optimum noise reduction I recommend a rigid or semi rigid ducting. The flexible ducting reflects too much of the noise from the damper.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Renovations

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: Installed this about 6 mo ago and love how quiet it is. Seems to be very well made and installed without a hitch. Also Love having the built in heater for those chilly mornings. Heats up the bathroom nice and toasty in no time! I looked at other fans with a built in light, but decided I would rather have the heater.
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: Years later and still working perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Really quiet, you do hear it but really quiet. Still running perfect since my electrician installed it. I did quite a bit of research before choosing it and I am still very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn PDX

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this first in our home to make sure it was quality. Now we put them in homes that we remodel. The heater hats well and the exhaust fan is effective. You can adjust the direction the heat blows easily from under the cover. We have ours pointing toward the mirror, so it keeps it de-fogged while heating the bathroom-bonus! They are both relatively quite when compared to other units. The night light is a nice feature that we use all the time. Ours has been installed for 5 years with no issues. The price changes constantly though so keep an eye on it. It has ranged from $200 to over $300 in a matter of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: S & C Boyd

customer_reviews.title: quiet and warm
customer_reviews.text: I actually have two of these: 1 with lights and 1 without the lights. They are quiet and efficient. The heat is especially appreciated when getting out of the shower or tub. The one with the light is sufficient to supply ambient light to a standard 6' x 8' bathroom by itself. The larger bathroom that is 7' x 12' gets no moisture on the mirrors at all if used with both the fan and heater and the same time, and has helped to eliminate the mold problem I used to contend with. I use them with digital timers, which helps keep power usage reasonable by eliminating the machine from running longer than necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie N

product_meta.title: Panasonic FV-11VH2 WhisperWarm Fan/Heater Combination, Ventilation Fan, Extremely Quiet, Long Lasting, Easy to Install, Code Compliant, Energy Star Certified, White
product_meta.description:
Style:FanFROM THE MANUFACTURER
Panasonic WhisperWarm Ceiling Mounted Fan/Heat Combinations are smaller, quieter, warmer, and easier to install. A tubular, stainless-steel-sheathed heating element features Nichrome wire with magnesium oxide for optimal heat transfer and electrical insulation at elevated temperatures. The Panasonic FV-11VH2 WhisperWarm 110 CFM heater/fan has a totally enclosed condenser motor and a large, double suction blower wheel to quietly move air. The blower wheel is designed to draw air in from both sides allowing more area for the air to enter the wheel. Panasonic fans are quiet enough that you might not even know they're on. With a .6 sone level and rated 110 cubic feet per minute, this fan is designed to give you continuous, trouble-free operation for many years due to its high-quality components and permanently lubricated motors which wear at a slower pace. We designed the electrical configuration of this model's condenser motor to allow it to operate at lower temperatures, increasing the life of the motor and bearings. And, the fan housing is made of heavy-gauge zinc galvanized steel and painted to protect it from rust. This fan has a built-in damper to prevent back draft, which helps to prevent outside air from coming through the fan. The Panasonic FV-11VH2 WhisperWarm 110 CFM Ceiling Mounted Fan/Heat Combination is covered by a manufacturer warranty for period of three years from the date of the original purchase and is sold one item per package. Product dimensions: Mounting Opening (inches sq.)17 3/8" x 12 5/8"; Grille Size (inches sq.)18 1/8"L x 13 5/16"W.
feature_bullets: EXTREMELY QUIET: At .6 sones, this bathroom fan is so quiet you might not know it's on.

LONG LIFE, GUARANTEED: Panasonic ventilation fans use less energy to move larger volumes of air. Less energy leads to less overheating and motor failure, saving you on repair costs. Included 3-year limited warranty.
EASY-TO-INSTALL: Designed for use with 4" ducts, this ventilation vans comes with all needed mounting hardware.
HEATED, CLEAN AIR: Increase your air quality as you eliminate chilly mornings in addition to humidity, mold, mildew, and other air pollutants from any room.
CODE COMPLIANT: This product is ENERGY STAR certified and complies with ASHRAE 62.2, LEED, California Title 24, Washington VIAQ codes and standards.

specifications.Warranty Description: ALL Parts: For period of 3 years
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,312 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
